result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin M Wendler #423208 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Deg. Sex Assault-Intoxicated Victim, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(2)(cm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
During period of prison incarceration, 50% of income during prison employment is to be applied toward restitution owed, per prison policy
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay victim before CVC.
.
Pay restutition and 10% restitution surcharge.  Restitution to be held open for 30 days to determine amount.

During period of Extended Supervision, restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician

No Contact with MMF or her family
.

Undergo sex offender treatment and follow-through with treatment recommended

Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by the PO and follow-through with any treatment recommended

The defendant is required to register as a sex offender for remainder of his life

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

Order that Atty Chris Gramstrup be allowed to withdraw as Counsel
to withdraw
From: Atty Gramstrup Re: motion to withdraw

Spoke to the Court of Appeals, they needed copies that had been signed properly. Chris was on vacation so I couldn't have him sign until today. Attached are the signed documents per the court of appeals
Court of appeals
Appeals Document Index saved for: 2018AP000496 by: Jody Wickler
Notice of Appeal and circuit court record was filed with the COA on 3/15/18  18AP496 CRNM
Letter to Atty Gramstrup from Def
Chris Gamstrup
from Atty Gramstrup   re: Notice of Apeal / Stmt on Transcript filed

Court: Wanted to get everyone on the phone to figure out what was going on.
Issue is what is happening with representation.  Some question if Mr Wendler 
wants Mr Gramstrup to represent him or not.
Comments from Gramstrup and Wendler
Wendler says he needs to see the Motion from the PD's office before he decides.
Court explains nothing will be sent until he decides if he wants Mr Gramstrup
to continue or not.
Wendler - simply can't trust Gramstrup but don't have money to hire attorney,
don't know what to do.
COURT: This is a bit of an Awkward situation.  I am going to take this OFF of the CALENDAR.
If time limits are missed because of things not being filed timely, then that is how it will be.
That is not for the Court to figure out.
Gramstrup - I will proceed at this point as his attorney and do my duties as required by Statute.
IT IS ORDERED that the time to file a postconviction motion or notice of appeal is extended to 4/20/18

from def   re: Motion to Withdraw as Counsel

State by Skemp /  Def & Atty Granstrup by phone
CRT calls Stanley Correctional
CRT:  I put this on calendar - trying to resolve an issue - letter was sent to me - I saw there wa Motion to Withdraw as Atty
Gamstrup:  met w/ def @ prison, he requested I w/draw so he could proceed pro se 
Wendler:  Mr Miller was hired for consulting - he wasn't to replace Gamstrup - concern right now is Gamstrup didn't serve me a copy of Mton to W/draw
Gamstrup:  I did send copy to CRT of Appeals & to Mr Wendler - if def doesn't want me to w/draw then that's fine, but he has to understand I'd be proceeding on no-merit basis
Def comments...not Waiving his right to assistance of counsel - def feels he did not get record reviewed very well - def has been in contact w Atty Schroeder & Mr Miller - Atty Gamstrup has not called or asked anything from Atty Schroeder
CRT:  We can continue this 2-3 weeks - if there's an agreement I can just sign the Motion to Withdraw w/o a Hrg.  Sounds like def is saying he needs new apptmt thru Pub Def office
Add Mr Miller for getting a Notice for next Hrg so he can appear

CRT'S SENTENCE:  Def sentenced to WSP for total length of sentence of 10 yrs:
- Initial Term of confinement is 6 yrs - def is not eligible for CIP or SAP
- Extended Supervision is 4 yrs w/ conditions:  AODA & follow-thru w/ trmt recommended;  No alcohol or drugs;  No Contact w/ MMF or their family;  Comply w/ Sex Offender treatment & follow-thru w/ any recommendations made;  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed approp by PO & follow-thru w/ any trmt recommended;  Pay restitution - amt to be det - def to pay 50% of income during period of prison incarceration towards restitution - restitution to be left open 30 days to determine amt;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Def is required to register as sex offender for remainder of life
